model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I loaded up on repellent like you said and I also grabbed a few of those mosquito repellent bracelets, I figured why not!
Speaker B: Have you been hiking lately?
Speaker A: Yes I did actually. I lead some friends on a hike in a local trail last weekend. They got tired really quickly as they never go hiking they told me.
Speaker B: Sounds like me. I am not a fan of the outdoors. Did your friends manage to have a good time anyway?

[MEMORY]
Speaker A enjoys going on camping trips and hiking trails in parks. This has led to Speaker A planning several camping trips for the summer and deciding to do a part of the Appalachian Trail. Speaker A enjoys camping and hiking as free activities, and this aligns with their interest in looking for wild animals in the woods.

speaker: Speaker A
raw_prediction: They did have a good time, despite getting tired quickly. It was nice to share my love for hiking with them.
prediction:
Brief explanation: The memory provides background information about Speaker A's interest in outdoor activities like camping and hiking, which can be used to give a more enriched response about Speaker A's friends having a good time or not in the hiking trip.
Judgement: Yes
